page.title: 17ECOLOGY IN PLAYING PLACE/KEA
page.content: There are 37{footpaths}in our block almost all of which have been in existence for hundreds of years. A new one has been built from Playing Place to Kea School. Most{footpaths are now used for exercise. Almost all Elm trees have been destroyed by{Dutch Elm disease.}New ones ones are being planted. Large birds of prey like{Buzzards are coming back to nest and hunt that they are{protected by Law.}Recently, {Red squirrels}have been seen again. Following the destruction of the {rabbit}by the disease{Myxomatosis}the rabbits are again breeding well and the{fox}population has also increased. {Badgers}are being blamed for causing {cattle diseases}so the authorities are gasing them.Some{conservationists}do not agree with this action and so protest against it.
